page.title: 01An area of Whitsand Bay
page.content: This area offers outstanding coastal views accross Whitsand Bay towards Rame Head to the east and Looe to the west. From the cliffs at Tregantle on a clear day you can see the Eddystone Lighthouse 12 miles out to sea. The beaches of Whitsand Bay attract many people during the summer season not just for the sandy beaches but for surfing (one of the few spots on the south coast), sea fishing and scuba-diving. Recently hang-gliders have been taking full advantage of the steep cliffs along the bay. The B3247 road divides the rough cliff top land and golf course south of the road from the farm land to the north. Trethill Cliffs and Tregantle Cliff are owned by the National Trust. A narrow road which runs along the cliff's edge between Freathy and Tregantle allow the traveller a stunning seascape.
